intro: Fessia assadii, commonly known as the Assad's fessia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Fessia assadii is considered a vulnerable species.
